http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/contribu.@value:
Oscar Corcho (Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
http://orcid.org/0000-0002-9260-0753

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value:
This ontological module contains classes and properties that provide information related to poetic works and their manifestations and other characteristics.
It also provides transversal information that is ussefull in different specific domains related and covers different aspects to complete tehe information related with the poetic work
The concepts dealt with are Person, Organization, Event, Place and Role

http://purl.org/dc/terms/publisher.@value:
POSTDATA Project “This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement Nº [679528])”
        Principal Investigator. Elena González Blanco -- <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0448-1812>
        Technical Director. Salvador Ros Muñoz -- <https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6330-4958>

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Any agentive Object , either physical, or social.
Function of a person or organization in the creation of a poetic work, redaction or other transmission element

An abstract work that contains more than one Poetic Work. An Ensemble might be conceived as a collection of works, organized by author, by book song, by book of poems; or as a work mainly written in prose that contains more than one poetic pieces (each one of them being its own Poetic Work)
Eg.: Les fleurs du mal
A thing that happens or takes place
An ordered list of text units with a given length and indexed elements.

Named collection of people regarded as a single unit
Eg.: Typical examples include institutions such as ‘UNED’ or ‘the BBC’ and businesses such as ‘Google’ but also racial or ethnic groupings or political factions where these are regarded as forming a single agency such as ‘the Carthaginians’ or ‘the Communists’

A human being regarded as an individual. This person could have existed in real life or it may be fictional.
Eg.: D. Quijote de la Mancha
A particular position, point, or area in space; a location

Abstract concept of an artistic creation. In POSTDATA these creations must be in verse (poem, play, song)
Eg.: Os Lusíadas by Luis Vaz de Camões; La Commedia by Dante; the poem Ad te deus by an Anonymous author written in between the 7th and 9th centuries

Representatives of a work, that is, of an Poetic Work. Each version of a work is its own redaction.
Eg.: The palaeographic edition of A solis ortu usque ad occidua preserved in Lat. 1154 (BNF) and its critical edition are two Redaction of the same Poetic Work
Function of a person or character
Text unit on an ordered list
It contains an additional name component, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name
A file (XML, PFD, plain text) which contains the Redaction and, likely, other type of analytical information
Contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organisation, or an individual
This property points to an instance of Role who is affected by the current function (e.g. the role performed by an actress)
Alternative name that references the current item
Alternative name, other known denominations of a text or tune
The meant readership, viewers or listeners of a cultural product
Level of education of the recipients of a text/song

Level of education of the creator of a text/song (this property has as Domain "PoeticWork" and not "Person" since the education level of a person changes during time. This is the education level of the author in the moment of writing the poem)
The text unit belongs an ordered list of a textual units
An account of a person's life written, composed, or produced by another
Date of birth
This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of Person
Certainty of the date of birth
Level of confidence regarding the correspondent function
An explanatory series of notes or comments; an explanatory essay or treatise on a text
This property points to an ensemble, PoeticWork or Redaction which was authored by the current Creator
This property points to an date entity that represents a particular point or period of time at which something happened or existed, or is expected to happen
Date of death
This property points to the instance of Place where the current Person has died
An ethnic group; a social group that shares a common and distinctive culture, religion, language, or the like
Text that narrates the event, that is, an excerpt of the Redaction
The closing words of the composition (usually, the last verse)
A person’s period of activity (to use when a range cannot be stablished; eg. “3rd century”)
It contains a forename, given or baptismal name
Purpose of the work (e.g. prayer, spell, curse)
It contains a name component used to distinguish otherwise similar names on the basis of the relative ages or generations of the persons named
The gender of the Person
Type of art, literature or music characterized by a specific form, content and style
This property points to a function (an instance of Role) that has somehow affected the item at hand (e.g. sponsor)
This property points to a group of characters, an instance of Agent( Organisation or Person) depicted in the text
This property points to the entity Creator that has created the current work under analysis
This property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) which was dedicated to the current Person
This property points to the Person who has edited the current instance of Redaction
This property points to the first text unit  which form the current element under analysis
This property points to one of the persons (instance of Person) who belongs to the current Organisation
List of  text units that form the redaction
This property points to one of the works (an instance of PoeticWork) which form the current element under analysis
A text unit in an ordered list.
This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) which contains a translation of the text at hand
The first line of the work
This property points to a Organisation, Person or Place  which are related to the current instance of Event
Whether the Redaction was composed to be sung
This property points to an instance of Role that affects the current role (e.g. actress who performs the role at hand)

This property points to the work (instance of PoeticWork) which depicts the Role at hand in relation to its contents. When the Role at hand is related to the agents that participated in the transmission of the work (e.g. sponsor), this property points to the entity affected by the current function
In case the identity of current instance of Creator is unknown
This property points to one of the agents, almost always Person  to whom the current Role belongs.
A calligram is a text visually arranged in a way that it forms an image associated with the text’s contents
his property points to the text in which the current instance of Person or Organisatrion is a character
This property points to a Person who died in the current instance of Place
This peroperty points to one of the persons (an instance of Person) to whom the current text was dedicated

This property points to the work (instance of PoeticWork) or a redaction which depicts the Role at hand in relation to its contents. When the Role at hand is related to the agents that participated in the transmission of the work (e.g. sponsor), this property points to the entity affected by the current function
This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) that contains an edition of the current instance of Redaction
This property points to an instance of Redaction which was edited by the the current Person
Whether the person under analysis is a fictional character
This property points to the container (an instance of Redaction) of which the item at hand is its first part
isFirstpart
This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of the item
This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) in which the current text is indexed
This property points to the Event in which the current instance of Organisation, Person or Place is referenced
This property points to the instance of Organisation to which the Person at hand belongs
This  property points to the text (an instance of Redaction) that records the current item under analysis
This property points to the instance of Ensemble to which the PoeticWork at hand belongs
This property points to an instance of Organisation that performs the current Role
This property points to one of the persons (instance of Person) to whom the current Role belongs
This property points to a text (an instance of Redaction) which is one of the materialisations of the work under analysis
This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) that registers the current item under analysis
This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) whose contents are related to the current item under analysis (usually, its specific bibliography)
This property points to one of the texts (an instance of Redaction) which is an analytical version of the text at hand (the current Redaction)
isSynthesis
This property points to the Entity whose provenance corresponds to the current instance of Place
This property points to another work (an instance of Redaction) from which the current item being analysed was translated
This property points to another version (an instance of Redaction) which is a translation of the current item being analysed
In case the identity of the current instance of Creator is certainly a wrong attribution
A significant or descriptive word. Usually, a word used as a reference point for finding other words or information
Language of the text
The arrangement of textual materials (images included) on a page

Label of a time frame for grouping certain works. Cf. "school".
The values of this property are defined in a controlled vocabulary about literary periods.
The literary tradition assigned to a composition
This property points to an instance of Event  or Person or Organisation or Place that is referred in the current under analysis
Contains a proper noun or noun phrase that refers the current agent
Contains a connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it, such as van der or of
Location of the narrative
An ethnic group forming a part of one or more political nations
This property points to the next text unit  which, together with the current item, form the same redaction
Comment or explanations
Number of lines in item
Number of plays in item
Number of poems in item
Number of PrimarySources used in the elaboration of an edition
The language from which the Redaction/Poetic Work is a translation
Name of the place as it appears in the source text
The identifying name of a text or tune as it appears in its PrimarySource
The recasting of the contents in words different from that originally used, whether in the same language or in a translation
A fictitious name, especially a pen name. A variant name
This property points to one of the roles (an instance of Role) performed by the current Person or Organisation
Major literary genre of the composition, that is, drama or poetry. The values of this property are defined in a controlled vocabulary about poetic types
URL to a digital image file that depicts the person
Contains a name component which indicates that the referent has a particular role or position in society, such as an official title or rank
This property points to the previous text unit  which, together with the current item, form the same textual unit
previousPart
This property points to the Place which is the provenance of the current instance of Ensamble or Poetic Work
This property points to the work (an instance of Opus) of which the text at hand (the current Redaction) is a materialisation
Association of a person with a religion, denomination or sub–denominational religious group. The values of this property are defined in a controlled vocabulary about religious affiliation
This property points to the specific location in a bibliographic item (an instance of Location) which contains the edition used as the base of text at hand
Job performed by some agent (e.g. sponsor, actor, collector, singer, arranger, transcriptor)
Function of a person or character. In a play, it is the part played by a performer
Excerpt
Literary movement/school of the author
The social status of the Person, that is the position or rank of a Person within the society
Note about the source used to give a particular piece of information
A secondary, usually explanatory title
Contains a family (inherited) name, as opposed to a given, baptismal, or nick name

Reference to textual contents . The contents of this property do not allow finer analysis by stanza or line. It can be a text of a diplomatic edition, semidiplomatic edition or of a critical edition (among others) or even a translation. The property typeOfRedaction defines the type of Edition or if it is a translation
Subject of a text, song or image
Type of character (eg. “main”, “antagonist”, etc.)
Type of designation/name. E.g. pseudonym, heteronym, allonym, orthonym variant
Type of event, for instance its modality (real, fictional...)
Type of place (e.g. fictional)

The type of the text provided in the Redaction 
Eg.: Diplomatic edition, critical edition, translation
The type of textual element (e.g. part of a greater ensemble; part of a composed collection of poems; prologue of a work; epilogue of a work; a chapter of a work...)
There are references that mentioned a PrimarySource for the text at hand but the real textual artefact has not been identified
This property points to another text (an instance of Redaction) which is a synthesis of the version at hand (the current Redaction)
usedForSynthesis
Primary sources of the text excluded during the elaboration of an edition (usually, dependent witnesses)
Number that identifies the text, for instance, inside a collection
A summary of the resource.
The altitude of a location. For example 37.42242 (WGS 84).
The latitude of a location. For example 37.42242 (WGS 84).
The longitude of a location. For example 37.42242 (WGS 84).
